thread.title: Top 5 Camping Sites Near Toronto

author: admin
title: Top 5 Camping Sites Near Toronto
text:
Home > Camping > Top 5 Camping Sites Near Toronto Top 5 Camping Sites Near Toronto   23, 2015 Pin It 
Camping is a term which is used quite loosely these days. However, it is one of the most incredible methods of building family memories. Apart from this, it can also be said that it is the best family vacation as it helps in bringing people back to basics. 
Traditionally, camping meant spider hot dogs, bear spray, sandy sleeping bags and deer flies. But, in the modern society, camping means something more than all these. From furnished cabins to karaoke nights, campgrounds serving as camp resorts. 
Nowadays, there is not a single place on this planet where you would not be able to find a camp resort with all the basic facilities. The same goes for Toronto as well. There are many wonderful camping sites near Toronto to enjoy . Best Camping Sites near Toronto 
Some of the best Camping Sites near Toronto, where you can enjoy with your family while camping are as follows: 1000 Islands Camping Resort 
The 1000 Islands Camping Resort at Brockville in Ontario offers varied activities for both adults and children. This camping resort is located in a region which provides abundant scopes of swimming, boating, fishing, golfing and hiking. 
The facilities offered at this campsite include laundry facilities, washroom featuring hot showers, camp store, Bingo night, mini-putt, wagon rides for children and many more things. 
For more information: 1000 Islands Camping Resort JellyStone Park Camp Resort 
This camping resort near Toronto is one of the best locations for campers who have a good budget in hand. The campsite is a kiddie park or playground because it provides amusement type experience to the visitors. 
For further details: JellyStone Park Camp Resort Elora Gorge Conservation Area 
This area is a mix of unserviced and serviced sites. This conservation area offers stunning views of cliffs from trails ranging 22 meter high. Campers have the option of tubing down or kayaking the river. It lies very close to the picture-perfect town of Elora. 
For more information: Elora Gorge Conservation Area Algonquin Provincial Park 
This is one of the best camping sites near Toronto and is specially meant for canoeists, bird lovers and hikers. There are more than 250 species of birds found at this park. You can find a total of 12 fully-developed and facilitated campgrounds at this park offering great camping experiences. 
For more details: Algonquin Provincial Park Bronte Creek Provincial Park 
This campsite lies between Burlington and Oakville and it offers a number of hiking trails. You will also find a small animal farm at this campground which includes beautiful peacocks.
